books.author: by Lisa Taddeo
books.description: The inequality of female desire is explored through the sex lives of a homemaker, a high school student and a restaurant owner.
books.name: THREE WOMEN

books.author: by Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.
books.name: EDUCATED

books.author: by Mollie Hemingway and Carrie Severino
books.description: The conservative authors give their take on the confirmation of Supreme Court Justice Brett Kavanaugh.
books.name: JUSTICE ON TRIAL

books.author: by David McCullough
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning historian tells the story of the settling of the Northwest Territory through five main characters.
books.name: THE PIONEERS

books.author: by Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes her journey from the South Side of Chicago to the White House, and how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent.
books.name: BECOMING

books.author: by Mark R. Levin
books.description: The conservative commentator and radio host makes his case that the press is aligned with political ideology.
books.name: UNFREEDOM OF THE PRESS

books.author: by Steven M. Gillon
books.description: A historian describes John F. Kennedy Jr. through the lens of their decades-long friendship.
books.name: AMERICA'S RELUCTANT PRINCE

books.author: with related materials by The Washington Post
books.description: Redacted findings from the special counsel’s investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election and potential obstruction of justice by the president.
books.name: THE MUELLER REPORT

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up biracial in apartheid South Africa by the host of “The Daily Show.”
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by Yuval Noah Harari
books.description: How Homo sapiens became Earth’s dominant species.
books.name: SAPIENS

books.author: by Lori Gottlieb
books.description: A psychotherapist gains unexpected insights when she becomes another therapist’s patient.
books.name: MAYBE YOU SHOULD TALK TO SOMEONE

books.author: by James Patterson and John Connolly with Tim Malloy
books.description: The story of a South Florida financier convicted of soliciting sex from underage girls.
books.name: FILTHY RICH

books.author: by Jon Meacham and Tim McGraw
books.description: Pulitzer Prize winner Jon Meacham and Grammy Award winner Tim McGraw explore how America was shaped by music.
books.name: SONGS OF AMERICA

books.author: by Robin DiAngelo
books.description: Historical and cultural analyses on what causes defensive moves by white people and how this inhibits cross-racial dialogue.
books.name: WHITE FRAGILITY

books.author: by Rick Atkinson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning historian and journalist begins his Revolution Trilogy with events from 1775 to 1777.
books.name: THE BRITISH ARE COMING
